Glavine was charged with seven runs and got only one out in the second-shortest start of his career , a loss to the Florida Marlins on the final day of the season to complete New York 's historic collapse in the NL East race .
But at least it was better than his last outing with the Mets .
Working from behind to all but five of 22 hitters , Glavine surrendered seven hits , walked two and threw 97 pitches -- only 52 for strikes .
The 42-year-old left-hander has clearly lost a bit of the stuff that carried him to five 20-win seasons and two NL Cy Young Awards during his first stint with the Braves .
He had long since showered and dressed by the time it was over .
Glavine was the big story at the start of the night , returning to the team where he spent the first 16 seasons of his 303-win career .
At the end , though , his record was 1 - 0 .
John Russell watched stoically from the Pirates dugout in his first game as a big league manager , perhaps wondering what he 'd gotten himself into .
It fell between them , allowing two runs to score .
Jason Bay inexplicably ran by the ball , apparently thinking Nate McLouth had called him off .
Not so fast .
Game over ?
McCann , who homered in the fourth , followed with a soft fly to left .
Mark Teixeira popped out , slapping his helmet in disgust .
Chipper Jones followed with a two - run single , making it 9 - 7 , then it looked as though Pittsburgh would escape .
Damaso Marte walked two , then closer Matt Capps walked two more to bring home a run .
The Pirates had a five - run cushion with Atlanta down to its last three outs , but no lead is safe for a franchise that has n't had a winning season since 1992 .
They missed quite a finish .
Most of the crowd of 45,269 headed for home on a cool night when Pittsburgh went ahead with a four - run eighth off Manny Acosta .
The Braves ' defense was n't better , making three costly errors .
He left after the fifth , having surrendered one earned run , and turned over a 4 - 2 lead to the bullpen .
Glavine returned to Atlanta after five years with the New York Mets .

It was in doubt right to the end : Jeff Francoeur homered , Matt Diaz had an RBI single and the Braves had the potential tying run on base when Corky Miller flied out to center , ending the 4-hour , 28-minute marathon .
Franquelis Osoria ( 0 - 1 ) pitched three innings for his first major league win .
But Nady , who led off the eighth with a homer , lined a 2 - 0 pitch from Blaine Boyer ( 0 - 1 ) into the right-field seats with two outs and two aboard in the 12th .
The Braves took advantage of four walks and a huge defensive blunder to erase the Pirates ' 9 - 4 lead .

Xavier Nady hit his second homer of the game , a three - run shot in the 12th inning , and the Pittsburgh Pirates overcame a horrific ninth and another potential collapse for a 12 - 11 win Monday night , ruining Atlanta 's home opener .
ATLANTA ( AP ) -- Tom Glavine 's homecoming was an afterthought by the time a routine fly ball finally ended a game that was anything but routine .
